subject: Good day to you,
body:
Good day to you,
Thanks for your answer and here is the proposal. I hope we can work together on what I'm about to discuss with you, I am a personal account officer to xxx and he has a huge sum of money with us, please do read and understand my email properly. In short, the fund in question was deposited with my bank by a late xxx. He had a fixed deposit at my bank worth $ 35,000,000.00 ($ 35 million) in 2005 for 108 calendar months. The due date for this deposit agreement was the last January 22, 2022. Unfortunately,xxx was one of the fatalities in the CoronaVirus of March 21, 2020, in which over 2,000 people were killed in Italy. He was on a business trip in Italy and so he came to an end.
My bank management doesn't know about his death yet, I knew about it because he was my friend and I'm his account officer. xxx didn't mention a Next of Kin / Heir when the account was opened, and he wasn't married or had any children. Last week my bank management asked for xxx. They need his instructions because he has to deal with us. I know that they will ask for xxx. That is why I have been looking for a solution, if my bank manager happens to know that xxx is dead and has no heir, they will take the money for their own personal use. So I don't want that. You have the same last name as xxx, if we work together I will present you as Next of Kin / Heir on the account.
The account will be released to you without risk. As xxx's former account officer, I can work out a structure that will allow you to be the next of kin; and the money is split 50/50 if you have the money on yours. I plan to spend some of my share in charity. Take this opportunity to work with me and I will give you the blueprint of how it will work perfectly without a doubt. I'll give you more details if I think you won't give me away.
Regards and God bless you,
Kathryn Peterson

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello Kathryn Peterson,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this intriguing proposal. I must say, it's quite an unusual situation you've found yourself in. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate demise of Mr. XXX.

I do have a few questions though, if you don't mind me asking. How did you come across my contact information? And why did you choose me specifically for this task? 

Also, could you please elaborate on the process of becoming the next of kin? What would be required from my end?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jonas

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Good day

Thanks for your response, and sorry for getting back to you late as I have
been busy for over a week now which kept me away from accessing my email.
Regarding your question, I got your contact online while searching for some
to work with me on this claim, I came across your details and decided to
initiate a contact. As a matter of fact this claim will be very quick if
you follow my instructions and it's 100 % risk free. The only thing that is
required of you is to keep it confidential between us (you and me) . I want
you to act as a relative to Mr. Peter, you should read my previous email
properly. I have the death certificate and all legal documents to back you
up on this transaction, therefore you have nothing to worry about.

The bank is called Monetary Choice Bank is a subsidiary of Towne Bank
Virginia and we share the same building with Virginia Trust Bank here in
Virginia. I will give you more information by contacting the bank and
lawyer. All you have to do is email the attorney letting them know that you
have an inheritance to claim from  Monetary Choice Bank  that the deceased
is your relative, I have the death certificate of Mr. Peter's which is the
most important paper our bank will actually request from you followed by a
legal approval by the court, as well as some other personal information
that you can provide.

Other than that, if all goes well, when our bank confirms you as the true
beneficiary of the money, You will need to open an account with an amount
of $ 200 which will be deposited into your new account until the
inheritance fund has been deposited into the account, I am preparing you as
an insider, I will also do the work within to make sure this result leads
to a success. I believe our claim should be completed within 3 banking
days..

I  hope to hear more from you.

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time you took to explain everything to me. I must admit, this is all very new and exciting for me.

I'm curious about a few things though. You mentioned that I would need to act as a relative of Mr. Peter. How exactly would that work? And what kind of legal documents are we talking about here?

Also, could you tell me more about Monetary Choice Bank? I've never heard of it before and I'd like to know more about it before proceeding with anything.

Lastly, you mentioned opening an account into which the funds will be deposited. Could you provide more details on this process?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Jonas

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time you took to explain everything to me. I must admit, this is all very new and exciting for me.

I'm curious about a few things though. You mentioned that I would need to act as a relative of Mr. Peter. How exactly would that work? And how did you come across Mr. Peter's details in the first place?

Also, could you tell me more about Monetary Choice Bank? What kind of bank is it and what services does it offer? 

Lastly, you mentioned opening an account with an amount which will be deposited into my new account until the fund has been deposited into the account. Could you please clarify this process a bit more?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Jonas

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello


Thank you again for your email, the Monetary Choice Bank is an online bank
and a subsidiary of Towne Bank Virginia. As we proceed you have to follow
my guideline as we proceed so we can accomplish this claim. You have
nothing to worry about as I will be one guiding you through. First you will
have to contact the bank attorney and explain you have a claim with the
Monetary Choice Bank. You shouldn't worry about anything because I am an
insider and everything will be fine. Also I will need you to brief me on
your working experience as we need this while proceeding with the
transaction, also if you don't mind I will like to know your full name and
if possible any means of identification.

 I feel relaxed doing this transaction with you and I am giving you 100%
assurance that you will never regret doing this with me as all protocols
will be duly observed to make sure everything goes as planned. All you need
to do is email the attorney first and let him know that you have an
inheritance claim with Monetary Choice Bank. Once you do that let me know,
I'll provide any document he needs as evidence.


I hope to hear from you soon.

   Regards
   Kathryn Peterson

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello Kathryn Peterson,

Thank you for your detailed email. It's great to hear that the Monetary Choice Bank is an online bank and a subsidiary of Towne Bank Virginia. I appreciate your guidance throughout this process.

I'm curious, could you tell me more about the role of the bank attorney in this claim? And how does my working experience factor into this process?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Jonas

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello

Thanks for your email response, you have to go through the bank attorney to
process the inheritance claim by acting as a relative of Mr. Peter. As for
your work experience I need to know so I can know if we can work together
investing in something reasonable after we have successfully claimed the
fund. I wish to know more about you.

subject: Re: Good day to you,
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your response. It's interesting to hear about the process through the bank attorney and acting as a relative of Mr. Peter. I'm curious, how does this usually work? 

As for my work experience, I've been involved in various fields throughout my life, always eager to learn new things. However, I'm not sure how relevant it would be to our current discussion.

Regarding investing after claiming the fund, could you please elaborate more on what kind of investments you're considering? It's always fascinating to learn about different investment opportunities.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Jonas
